intro: Pachypleuria tenuis, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Pachypleuria tenuis is adapted to arid conditions and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
